III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications.
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth B touched Youth A inappropriately in a car and in his room.
Bethany staff were notified but they did nothing about it. Youth B
asked Youth A to do things to him. Youth A went to Youth C's
room and Youth B was hiding in the room. Youth B forced Youth A
to have sex with him, and Youth C guarded the door. This
happened one time. The staff were notified and asked why Youth
B was still at Bethany and the staff would not answer. The staff
member that was notified was an (unknown) social worker. This
social worker was a white female, with blonde haired, heavyset
and she primarily spoke English.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via phone on 10/16/2023. She
reported having no further information to add to the complaint. The
only information available is from an interview Youth A had with
Law Enforcement. There is no information about who Youth B is or
if he roomed with Youth A.
Administrator 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
10/19/23. She reported having no knowledge of the complaint until
being informed about the issues during this meeting. She also
reported Youth A and Youth B were both in the program with Youth
A being placed from 4/26/23-5/20/23. Youth B was placed in the
program from 8/11/22-5/24/23. There is an overlap of Youth A and
Youth B from 4/26/23 to 5/20/23. She reported Youth A is living out
of state and Youth B is in another program in Grand Rapids. She
was able to identify Youth C who is now living out of state.
Administrator 1 was interviewed again face to face at the
facility on 10/23/23 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. She
reported Youth A was identified in the last complaint
(2023C0000686) as a possible victim of a staff member. She
described Youth B as being openly against homosexuals and
having a habit of touching peers and staff without their permission.
She denied hearing anything from staff at the facility about the
allegations or behaviors similar to the allegations.
Administrator 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
10/19/23. He reported having no knowledge of the allegations until
being told of the complaint. He remembered Youth A and Youth B
but never observed the allegations take place. He also reported
2

Clinician is the individual identified by Youth A when Youth A stated
he told the “social worker”. Administrator 2 was interviewed
again face to face at the facility on 10/23/23 in collaboration
with MDHHS worker. He reported Youth A started the program in
a room with two other youth but requested a single room which
was provided. Youth A told staff he was homosexual as the reason
for wanting a single room. Administrator 1 reported Youth A and
Youth B did not like each other and when on community outings
they were noticed to be avoiding each other. He described Youth
B as needing higher supervision levels because he was violating
personal boundaries with other youth and staff. Youth B would
touch others “a lot” and his pushing boundaries caused a lot of
frustration for other youth. Youth B also struggled to follow
directions and Youth B would become upset when Youth A wanted
to dance for the group of youth. At times staff had to stop Youth B
from bullying and mimicking Youth A. Administrator 2 gave the
same report about the rules of youth not being in a bedroom they
are not assigned to. If a youth is in another youth’s bedroom, they
are asked to leave, and staff will stay in the room/doorway until
they leave the room.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 10/23/23
in collaboration with MDHHS worker. He remembers Youth A
and Youth B and still works with Youth B at the new placement.
Staff 1 denied ever being told by any youth of sexual touching or
abuse. He reported Youth A had no behavioral issues, but Youth B
struggled to follow directions.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 10/23/23
in collaboration with MDHHS worker. He reported remembering
Youth A and Youth B and was never informed of any sexual issues
by either youth. He reported there were no issues with Youth A,
but Youth B had a history of not respecting staff or other youth. At
times Youth B would bully others and Youth B was a “tough kid” to
deal with. Staff 2 reported he would inform his supervisor and
make a report to MDHHS if being told about sexual issues at the
facility between youth. He reported youth are not allowed to go
into each other’s rooms.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 10/23/23
in collaboration with MDHHS worker. She reported not
remembering Youth A but remembering Youth B. Youth B was a
difficult youth to work with because Youth B was not good with
boundaries on somedays. Staff 3 reported she had no problem
3

with Youth B because she set strong boundaries for him. She
denied being told of sexual touching or abuse by any youth at the
facility. She also reported she would report any abuse if finding out
about it right away. She reported youth are not allowed in other
youth’s rooms without supervision.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 10/23/23
in collaboration with MDHHS worker. She reported
remembering Youth A and Youth B and neither ever reported
anything similar to the allegations. Youth A liked to dance and did
well interacting with the other youth. She also reported Youth B
gave staff a rough time and refused to follow direction often. Youth
B struggled with boundaries and was often touching or putting his
arm around other youth and staff. Youth B would grab other
youth’s pants even though the rule is youth are not to touch each
other. Youth B had good intentions but would also have emotional
outbursts and bully other youth at times. Staff 4 reported she
would make a MDHHS report if having knowledge of sexual
touching or abuse between youth in the program. She reported
the rules for bedrooms as youth not being allowed to enter other
youth’s bedrooms without staff being present even if given
permission by the youth in the bedroom. Both Youth A, Youth B,
and Youth C had single rooms.
Staff 5 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 10/23/23
in collaboration with MDHHS worker. He reported not
remembering Youth A but remembering Youth B. He described
Youth B as difficult and was always breaking windows and
throwing chairs. Youth B was a very difficult youth to help, and he
always had his own room. Youth B didn’t get along with the other
youth from his country. Staff 5 reported youth are not allowed in
other youth’s rooms without supervision. He reported Youth B and
Youth C avoided each other and almost got into a fight in the
beginning. Staff 5 reported he would report information to MDHHS
if being told about sexual abuse or touching.
Staff 6 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 10/23/23
in collaboration with MDHHS worker. She reported being the
case aid for both Youth A and Youth B. She described Youth A as a
very nice kid and Youth B as a funny person who respected her.
She denied either youth told her about sexual touching or abuse.
She reported would report information to MDHHS if being told
about sexual abuse or touching.
4

Clinician was interviewed face to face at the facility on
10/23/23 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. She reported
being the clinician for both Youth A and Youth B while they were in
the program and never having either report to her sexual abuse or
touching. She reported Youth A and Youth B were in single rooms
and never roomed together. Youth A had requested a room
change on 5/11/23 but gave no reasons other than he wanted his
own room. Youth A had informed her he was transgender. In
regard to Youth B, Clinician reported he would become aggressive
and punch walls or damage property at times when frustrated.
Youth B would threaten self-harm or harm to others. Clinician also
reported on 4/23/23 Youth B became sexually inappropriate during
an outing and staff had made a report of the incident. Youth B was
rubbing a picture of people against his groin.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
10/23/23 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. She reported
being the supervisor of the case manager for Youth A and Youth B.
The case manager is on vacation, so she provided her knowledge
of the two youth. She denied case manager was told of any sexual
touching or abuse when Youth A and Youth B were in the program.
She was told Youth B doesn’t like Youth A and that Youth B would
bully Youth A at times. Youth A had told case manager he was
transgender, and Youth A was open about this issue. Supervisor
also reported Youth A and Youth B never roomed together.
Supervisor reported case manager would inform her during their
supervision of any issues.
Youth A and Youth C were not available to be interviewed as
they were unable to be located.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the new facility on
10/23/23 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth B denied
the allegations through his interpreter. He also denied any acting
out or disruptive behavior while in the last placement with Youth A.
Documents Reviewed:
Federal Bureau of Investigation Child Victim and Child
Witness Identity Information date of entry 9/20/23. This
document outlines what Youth A informed Law Enforcement. Youth
A reported Youth B inappropriately touched Youth A in a car and in
Youth A’s room. Youth A also reported telling staff but having staff
not do anything about. Youth B was reported to ask Youth A to do
things with him, but no details were provided. Youth A reported
5

Youth B forced him to have sex with Youth B in Youth C’s room.
Youth A reported feeling scared of Youth B, so he felt forced to
have sex with Youth B. Youth A reported telling staff that Youth B
had touched his chest. Youth A also reported telling Clinician
about the incident with Youth B.
Bethany Christian services Procedure Manual for Preventing
sexual abuse in Unaccompanied Children Programs dated
6/30, 2023. This document outlines the supervision of youth in the
program and states “unannounced rounds” must be conducted
frequently during both day and night. Staff are also to deter sexual
abuse and sexual harassment.
Significant Incident Report date 5/11/23 for Youth A. This
document outlines the incident between Youth A and Youth B
when they were riding in the facility van after an outing. Youth B
sitting behind Youth A bounced a soccer ball of the head of Youth
A and when confronted by other youth, became angry. Youth B
grabbed jumper cables from behind his seat and began to swing
the cables around while yelling before replacing the cables to the
space behind his seat. Documentation indicates that during the
intervention taken by staff, Youth B reported accidently hitting
Youth A in the head with the ball and Youth A reported it was
forcefully thrown at his head. There were no further incidents that
evening. Both youths were recommended to continue with weekly
individual therapy.
Counseling Case Note Summary for Youth A dated 4/26/23,
5/2/23, 5/3/23, 5/11/23, 5/15/23, and 5/19/23, written by
Clinician. This document outlines Clinician’s interactions with
Youth A. Youth A reported feeling healthy, happy, and safe at the
facility. Youth A also reported doing well and having no concerns
about the facility. Clinician documented there are no mental health
concerns with Youth A. There is not documentation of Clinician
being told of sexual issues between Youth A and Youth B.
Youth A Clinical Closing Report Bethany Christian Services
dated 5/19/23. It is documented during weekly therapy sessions,
Youth A presented as calm and friendly. Youth A was well-oriented
to time, person, self, and place, and presented with logical
thinking. His only time of becoming dysregulated was the single
time Youth A missed his sponsor. Youth A is documented as
attending weekly therapy sessions and Youth A reported being
well-adjusted to the program. Youth A also reported feeling safe in
his room placement and with his roommates. Because there is no
6

mental health diagnosis nor concerning behaviors or thought
patterns, continued mental health intervention is not
recommended after discharge.
Safety Plans for Youth B dated 10/5/22, 1/5/23, and 1/9/23.
These safety plans were developed for agitation, assault, and
suicidal ideation presented by Youth B. Each of the safety plans,
outlines triggers for Youth B, coping skills for Youth B to overcome
issues, and staff’s interventions to help deescalate Youth B.
Five Significant Incident Reports dated 4/12/23, 4/16/23,
4/23/23, 4/24/23, and 5/12/23 for Youth B were reviewed. Four
of the five outlined Youth B’s violent and aggressive acting out
when experiencing a consequence or not receiving items the way
he wanted them. Youth B struggled with dysregulation when things
didn’t go the way he wanted them to go. Youth B was documented
as threatening staff and youth along with destroying property at
the facility. The fifth incident report outlines Youth B engaging in
inappropriate sexual behavior during an outing in the community.
Youth B is documented as taking a picture of an unidentified
person from a magazine and rubbing it on his genital area while
making sexual suggestive moves.
Counseling Case Note Summary for Youth B for the period of
time that overlapped with Youth A. This involved three
counseling sessions dated 5/2/23, 5/8/23, and 5/17/23. These
notes document Youth B’s phone contact with family and Youth B
being identified as positive.
Human Resources file for Clinician was reviewed. Clinician
had no disciplinary action documented in her HR file. Training
documents indicate Clinician completed her mandated reporter
training on 5/10/23.
Analysis Based upon interviews and written documentation there is no
evidence that supports Staff were informed of the reported sexual
abuse of Youth A. Therefore, there is no violation of staff failing to
report or not following policy.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
7

It is recommended no changes made to the license of this Child Caring Institution
